column4: You should fill in the date of the observation.
Fill in your real name. No nicknames are accepted.
Fill in your real and valid email address. An observation modification link will be sent to your mailbox.
Your phone number. The contact data you are givin will not be used for marketing or given to spammers, but rereachers might call you if they want more information related to the event.

column3: My can be shown as part the public observation data.
column4: If you unselect, the observation will be shown as anonymous on the Internet. Only administrators can see your name.

The difference is one minute at maximum

column3: How long did the fireball's flight last?
column4: Most fireballs last a couple of seconds. If the object's flight lasted longer than 20 seconds, it most likely wasn't a meteor.

column3: How did your fireball fade away?

column3: It disappeared behind an object (perhaps a tree or clouds)
